article.headline: Chicago St. 76, Texas-Pan American 69
article.story: CHICAGO -- Carl Montgomery had a double-double to pace Chicago State to a 76-69 victory over Texas-Pan American on Saturday. Montgomery had 15 points and 11 rebounds for the Cougars (7-17, 2-5 Great West Conference), who had lost 10 of their last 11 games. Kabangu Kasamba and Christian Wall scored 18 points apiece. Matt Mierzycki had 10 points and 14 rebounds for the Broncs (3-22, 2-4), who lost their sixth consecutive game. Aaron Urbanus scored 17 points and Julius Hearn 15. An altercation late in the foul-plagued game led to technicals for Steve Martin and Kasamba from Chicago State and Jared Maree and Rico Seagars of UTPA. Chicago State, which led 33-20 at halftime, went 6 of 19 from 3-point range. The Broncs were 7 of 20. The Broncs beat Chicago State 63-42 on Jan. 16 but have gone winless since.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
